alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 2:55AM EST until December 19 at 3:16PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New York NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Connecticut... Quinebaug River near Jewett City affecting New London County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Quinebaug River near Jewett City. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.5 feet, Norman Road and banjo Sullivan Road are closed with water covering the roadway. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 17.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.5 ft. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM EST Tuesday was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected maintain minor flood stage through this afternoon. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 04/14/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Quinebaug River Jewett City 17.5 17.6 Tue 2 am EST 16.1 14.1 MSG &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM EST.
